channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump says 'total reset negotiated' with China during tariff talks in Geneva
item.description: President Donald Trump touted trade negotiations with China in Switzerland Saturday, noting "many things" were discussed and "much [was] agreed to."

item.title: Democratic senator says there ‘needs to be space’ for Fetterman in party as Republicans come to his defense
item.description: Arizona Democratic Sen. Ruben Gallego defended Pennsylvania Sen. John Fetterman Saturday, saying there needs to be a place for him in the party.

item.title: A Tale of Two Art Fairs
item.description: TEFAF, the European Fine Art Foundation fair, and Frieze overlap, and they couldn’t be more different.

item.title: Mother’s Day Isn’t Easy for All Moms. Let’s Not Make It Harder
item.description: Let’s extend kindness and compassion toward moms who place their children for adoption.

item.title: India accuses Pakistan of violating ceasefire just hours after agreement
item.description: An Indian official accused Pakistan of breaking a truce hours after the U.S. mediated the agreement.

item.title: ICE facility Democrats 'stormed' holds child rapists, murderers: officials
item.description: Delaney Hall Detention Center "houses murderers, terrorists, child rapists and MS-13 gang members," DHS Assistant Secretary Tricia McLaughlin noted.

item.description: Donald Trump’s ‘liberation day’ was a mistake, but it’s always better to minimize the damage.

item.title: Why Pope Leo XIV Will Probably Not Be Francis 2.0
item.description: For Catholics, the new pope’s disposition toward the Latin Mass will tell us far more about his pontificate than his views on immigration.

item.title: Chicago Public Schools Pays $2.6M For Allegedly Forcing Students To Participate In Hindu Ritual
item.description: Kaya Hudgins, now 22, testified in a deposition that she was told participation in a 'Quiet Time' of Transcendental Meditation was mandatory.
